Articles.Content:
Wafle, I know you're awake....

8/10 I know you pretty well.
Have not seen you. Hi. 3/10
9/10 Seen you many times
3/10 Have not seen you too much.
3/10 Seeing you more.
10/10 How could I not Ã¢â‚¬â€¹know you?

8/10

I've seen you a lot, and I know your avatar.
8/10 The same to you.
7/10 Your the philosophical MLP fan.

1/10

Have no clue who all these people are....

Old time version 0.13 player who made an account two times for loosing it from the forum crash many years ago. Just came back to KSP since I think my 2 year break

1/10, I actually have never seen you on the forums before.

Also, how was 0.13 - did you crash into the sun?
2/10 I haven't seen you very much before.
8/10 I am familiar with you.

I honestly don't mean to come across as vain or self-obsessed here, but I'm genuinely interested and what to know, how "famous" (however you'd describe it) am I on these forums?

I haven't been around the longest, but I have been here a while, and I have also done several things. You may know me as the guy who makes rockets at the KMC. You may have met me in a stream. I have without a doubt, taught many players how to fly their rockets safely and effectively in space.

I know I've made an impact in a small part of this community... But how much would you say I have?

And again- I AM NOT TRYING TO BE VAIN, SELF-ABSORBED, whatever, I'm not. I'm just curious about what you guys think I am when it comes to "fame".

I've honestly never heard of you. So you are zero famous to me.

I'm a total newb, so take my lack of recognition with a HUGE grin of salt.
I've seen you around. I know who you are, sorta. But I think this is the wrong subforum, and there's already a Forum game about this.

I honestly don't mean to come across as vain or self-obsessed here, but I'm genuinely interested and what to know, how "famous" (however you'd describe it) am I on these forums?

I haven't been around the longest, but I have been here a while, and I have also done several things. You may know me as the guy who makes rockets at the KMC. You may have met me in a stream. I have without a doubt, taught many players how to fly their rockets safely and effectively in space.

I know I've made an impact in a small part of this community... But how much would you say I have?

And again- I AM NOT TRYING TO BE VAIN, SELF-ABSORBED, whatever, I'm not. I'm just curious about what you guys think I am when it comes to "fame".

As Gregrox has already put it, there's a thread elsewhere for just this very topic. As a matter of fact, I've just merged this one into it, for convenience

And to keep the game on the rails: 7/10 - I've seen you around a fair bit, though I wouldn't say I'm too familiar with any of your specific accomplishments.
5/10: Seen you a couple times
0\1 i dont know you are you a mod?
5/10 I've seen you a bunch, but only in the games section
1/10 - Just now lol, although I'm not around much. I do play KSP though, a lot, racked up 400+ hours according to Steam

I'm not around much.

1/10.
2/10 for me. I have a rocket company, started a research (more like explosions) group on K-Drives, but I did like 1% of the work on those projects.

I honestly don't mean to come across as vain or self-obsessed here, but I'm genuinely interested and what to know, how "famous" (however you'd describe it) am I on these forums?

I haven't been around the longest, but I have been here a while, and I have also done several things. You may know me as the guy who makes rockets at the KMC. You may have met me in a stream. I have without a doubt, taught many players how to fly their rockets safely and effectively in space.

I know I've made an impact in a small part of this community... But how much would you say I have?

And again- I AM NOT TRYING TO BE VAIN, SELF-ABSORBED, whatever, I'm not. I'm just curious about what you guys think I am when it comes to "fame".

8/10

I don't know you to well, but you answered a lot of my questions about RBs.

Back on track, 1/10 only seen you once or twice.

0/10

I don't know you, but its been a while since I've been back here
